componenttext: In terms of cost synergies, so on the merger, if I look at, basically, you're now running inside on a gross basis of your target. Is there anything identifiable? I know you don't track it sort of separately anymore. Is there sort of anything besides the fund merger and any associated impact with that, that's still to be done or is this the run rate?

componenttext: I would suggest that this is the run rate. Obviously, for all the business we continually look for opportunity to improve. But I'd say, in terms of kind of achieving what we wanted to achieve, I'd say we've delivered it.

componenttext: Okay. And then the $10 million of expense you mentioned around fund mergers, is that $10 million coming off of stepped up costs that affect that or is that just ongoing administrative costs that eventually come out?

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: It's the extra cost to administer all the mutual funds that, obviously, we've suggested are going to be streamlined. So that will come out when the funds go out. The only other stepped up costs that we've already discussed is from the $100 million, $95 mi
componenttext: It's the extra cost to administer all the mutual funds that, obviously, we've suggested are going to be streamlined. So that will come out when the funds go out. The only other stepped up costs that we've already discussed is from the $100 million, $95 million to $100 million, is the actual the implementation of the $15 million of marketing investment that will start end of this quarter, early next quarter.

componenttext: Yes, that's a very fair point, and we've struggled with this. We're trying to give insights without -- there are sensitivities from our distribution partners. So let's put it this way, it's in -- since we started, let's call it about 50-, 60-, 70-type funds, how's that?

componenttext: Okay. Just in terms of the blended net revenue yield excluding performance fees that came down slightly, I guess thinking with Van Kampen coming in and that's around 50 basis points, the decline sequentially is, what explains that? Is that just mix of the legacy Invesco business?

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: Our next question does come from Jonathan Casteleyn of Susquehanna.
componenttext: Our next question does come from Jonathan Casteleyn of Susquehanna.

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: I know you can't say a lot about where we're off Fund V. Can you just remind us, though, historically about Fund IV, when it was closed and then sort of historically, how long does it take these funds to get seasoned and potentially qualify for performanc
componenttext: I know you can't say a lot about where we're off Fund V. Can you just remind us, though, historically about Fund IV, when it was closed and then sort of historically, how long does it take these funds to get seasoned and potentially qualify for performance fees on sort of a look-forward basis?

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: Yes, so Fund IV closed in the end of 2007 and $4 billion, there were two closes as part of that, one in the third quarter, one in the fourth quarter. And in terms of the timing around performance fees or the carrier that we'd be receiving, it's hard to ob
componenttext: Yes, so Fund IV closed in the end of 2007 and $4 billion, there were two closes as part of that, one in the third quarter, one in the fourth quarter. And in terms of the timing around performance fees or the carrier that we'd be receiving, it's hard to obviously predict. It has everything to do with how quickly things get invested then get harvested and that has a lot to do with the current market environment. I think for Fund IV, it did not get invested as quickly as maybe some of the other funds have been for, given the market, it was prudent to wait and probably smart to have done that. And we have, obviously, been waiting for it to get to 75% invested because we could not launch another fund until that happened. In terms of the harvesting period, I think it's still going to be several years to be thinking about the timing before we actually see a performance fee. It's above a hurdle too, so you need to generate, I think it's 8.5% hurdle rate, generally. So I would guide a couple of years before you begin to think about performance fees for Fund IV.

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then just quickly, the buyback was listed as sort of the last priority as far as capital allocation. Can you then just sort of flush out in the quarter or just generally how the company tries to evaluate the stock and determine value or not? Because a
componenttext: And then just quickly, the buyback was listed as sort of the last priority as far as capital allocation. Can you then just sort of flush out in the quarter or just generally how the company tries to evaluate the stock and determine value or not? Because as I say, in the fourth priority position, you did buy back stock in the quarter. Is there any way to sort of just highlight?

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, we have our own models. We look out several years, and we understand kind of our target growth rates and so we spent a lot of time thinking about the value of the firm and kind of our growth trajectory. We also look at ourselves relative to competit
componenttext: Well, we have our own models. We look out several years, and we understand kind of our target growth rates and so we spent a lot of time thinking about the value of the firm and kind of our growth trajectory. We also look at ourselves relative to competitors, as you'd imagine. And so when we see that the market is not giving us value for, certainly this acquisition is a good example of something where saw a disconnect, we felt very good about our ability to go in and buy the stock at a lower price.

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010

componenttext: Jeff Hopson of Stifel.

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, I'll do the UITs. In terms of the UITs, in Q2, net flows were $0.4 billion and in Q3, it was $0.9 billion. So that was kind of the step up there. I think, obviously, the U.K. sales have been at record levels. They came off a little bit in the third
componenttext: Well, I'll do the UITs. In terms of the UITs, in Q2, net flows were $0.4 billion and in Q3, it was $0.9 billion. So that was kind of the step up there. I think, obviously, the U.K. sales have been at record levels. They came off a little bit in the third quarter. But I think the general feeling is a very positive element. So there isn't anything, I'd say, that’s causing us to think that there's a trend going down or anything, I think it's just noise that may --  the way things fund.

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: Yes, I'd say, look, they’ve done a tremendous job. And it's really, if anything, it's an environmental factor.
componenttext: Yes, I'd say, look, they’ve done a tremendous job. And it's really, if anything, it's an environmental factor.

headline: Invesco Ltd., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2010
componenttextpreview: That was more institutionally driven. And one of our very successful products, we have a very strong competitive position in the Stable Value, which is the type of product that goes into retirement accounts and it sort of used to be the default option. Pe
componenttext: That was more institutionally driven. And one of our very successful products, we have a very strong competitive position in the Stable Value, which is the type of product that goes into retirement accounts and it sort of used to be the default option. People who want to protect their assets will use that and many of the large players in that space have been exiting, and we continue to have one of the best performing products there. So we've been seeing a huge amount of interest in this quarter and then also in terms of the pipeline.

componenttext: Well, Loren and I would just like to thank everybody very much for participating in the questions. And again, we think it was a very strong quarter.
